channel.title: Notes On Korean
channel.description: Recent content on Notes On Korean

item.title: Feeling Stuck
item.description: I stepped away from learning korean for the last 6 to 8 weeks. Life got busy, so I stopped doing my daily flashcards and meeting with my online tutor.

item.title: Question Words?
item.description: Yesterday I couldn’t remember the word 언제 (when) for some reason, so I thought I review several question words today. 누구 = who 뭐 = what

item.title: 미용실 갔어요.
item.description: I went to a Korean hair salon today to get a haircut and (attempt to) practice my korean. It went…okay. Turns out chitchatting with a stranger in Korean for 20+ minutes is really difficult.

item.title: 안영 하세요!
item.description: I just finished Share Your Work by Austin Kleon. It’s a great (short) book that recommends learning out loud online. Here’s my favorite tidbits from the book:

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Jerry. I’m a husband and dad living in Chicago. My wife was born and raised in Korea and my two kids are both fluent Korean speakers.

item.title: Stuff
item.description: Learn to Type in Korean: TaDak TaDak: Great web app to learn the basics. Fast Fingers (Korean Version): Fun web app to practice getting faster. The english version is pretty fun too.
